title: ICML_2016_10_abs

sentences.text: This paper solves a specialized regression problem to obtain sampling probabilities for records in databases .
The goal is to sample a small set of records over which evaluating aggregate queries can be done both efficiently and accurately .
We provide a principled and provable solution for this problem ; it is parameterless and requires no data insights .
Unlike standard regression problems , the loss is inversely proportional to the regressed-to values .
Moreover , a cost zero solution always exists and can only be excluded by hard budget constraints .
A unique form of reg-ularization is also needed .
We provide an efficient and simple regularized Empirical Risk Minimization -LRB- ERM -RRB- algorithm along with a theoretical generalization result .
Our extensive experimental results significantly improve over both uniform sampling and standard stratified sampling which are de-facto the industry standards .

summary: This paper solves a specialized regression problem to obtain sampling probabilities for records in databases . The goal is to sample a small set of records over which evaluating aggregate queries can be done both efficiently and accurately . We provide a principled and provable solution for this problem ; it is parameterless and requires no data insights . Unlike standard regression problems , the loss is inversely proportional to the regressed-to values . Moreover , a cost zero solution always exists and can only be excluded by hard budget constraints . A unique form of reg-ularization is also needed . We provide an efficient and simple regularized Empirical Risk Minimization -LRB- ERM -RRB- algorithm along with a theoretical generalization result . Our extensive experimental results significantly improve over both uniform sampling and standard stratified sampling which are de-facto the industry standards .

Predicate-solves.label: solves
Predicate-solves.description: The predicate 'solves' indicates that the subject has successfully addressed or overcome a challenge, obstacle, or difficulty represented by the object. It implies a sense of resolution, completion, or triumph over the problem or issue at hand.

Predicate-to_obtain.label: to obtain
Predicate-to_obtain.description: To obtain indicates a relationship where the subject takes action or makes an effort to acquire or gain access to something specified by the object. The predicate suggests a sense of procurement, attainment, or achievement, implying that the subject has taken steps to get what it wants from the object.

Predicate-sample.label: sample
Predicate-sample.description: To sample means to select or extract a portion from a larger whole, often for the purpose of representation, analysis, or evaluation. The predicate 'sample' establishes a connection between the subject and object by indicating that the subject has been reduced or condensed into a smaller form, which is then represented by the object.

Predicate-evaluating.label: evaluating
Predicate-evaluating.description: The predicate 'evaluating' indicates the process of assessing or determining the value or quality of something (the subject), typically in relation to a specific standard, criteria, or method (the object).

Predicate-have.label: have
Predicate-have.description: The predicate 'have' indicates a relationship of possession or association between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has, possesses, or is related to the described property or characteristic expressed by the object.

Predicate-exists.label: exists
Predicate-exists.description: The predicate 'exists' indicates that there is at least one instance or entity of the object that corresponds to the subject. It implies the presence, occurrence, or existence of something related to the subject.

Predicate-can_be_excluded_by.label: can be excluded by
Predicate-can_be_excluded_by.description: The predicate 'can be excluded by' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., an idea, option, or solution) can be eliminated or ruled out due to the presence of the object (e.g., constraints, limitations). The connection between the subject and object suggests that the existence or feasibility of the subject is conditional upon the absence or relaxation of the object.

Predicate-always_exists_and_can_only_be_.label: always exists and can only be excluded by
Predicate-always_exists_and_can_only_be_.description: This predicate indicates that a particular condition or state (subject) inherently exists and cannot be eliminated unless there are specific circumstances or factors (object) that prevent it from being present. The object serves as an exception to the rule, highlighting what can potentially disrupt or negate the existence of the subject.

Predicate-is_also_needed_for.label: is also needed for
Predicate-is_also_needed_for.description: The predicate 'is also needed for' indicates a relationship where the subject (a resource or entity) plays an essential role in facilitating or enabling the object (an action, process, or outcome). In this sense, the subject is not only necessary but also instrumental in achieving the desired result.

Predicate-provides.label: provides
Predicate-provides.description: The predicate 'provides' indicates that the subject offers or furnishes something (the object), often implying a sense of fulfillment, satisfaction, or meeting a need. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject's action or existence leads to the provision of the object.

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' indicates that a certain condition or property must be met in order to satisfy or fulfill something. It implies a necessary relationship between the subject and object, where the subject needs or demands the presence of the object's characteristic(s) or quality(ies).

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or category of a more general concept represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a subcategory or specialization of the object.
